name: A. Complicated GCD
statement:
Greatest common divisor of two positive integers and is equal to the
biggest integer such that both integers and are divisible by . There are
many efficient algorithms to find greatest common divisor , for example,
Euclid algorithm. Formally, find the biggest integer , such that all
integers are divisible by . To make the problem even more complicated we
allow and to be up to googol, such number do not fit even in 64-bit
integer type!
editorial:
We examine two cases:

a?=?b  the segment consists of a single number, hence the answer is a.
a?<?b  we have gcd(a,?a?+?1,?a?+?2,?...,?b)?=?gcd(gcd(a,?a?+?1),?a?+?2,?...,?b)?=?gcd(1,?a?+?2,?...,?b)?=?1.
